name: St. Sidonius Apollinaris

locations.description: Bishop of Clermont, poet and letter writer

summary: Sidonius Apollinaris was a bishop, poet, and letter writer who provides valuable historical insights into the transition from Roman to barbarian rule in Gaul. He was Bishop of Clermont and was known for his literary works, including poems and extensive correspondence. His letters are an important source for understanding the social, political, and religious life of 5th-century Gaul during the period of barbarian invasions.
